page.title: 13ECONOMICS IN CRUDEN BAY.
page.content: There is one bank in Cruden Bay. It is the Clydesdale Bank. Two boys from Port Erroll School interviewed Mr. Barron, the Manager. He told them that the Bank was originally The North of Scotland Bank, and it began in Cruden Bay in 1883. It was then situated near the Kilmarnock Arms Hotel. In 1963 it became the Clydesdale and North of Scotland Bank and a few years later the Clydesdale Bank. There are 1500 customers. Opening hours:- 09.30 - 12.30 Mon. - 13.30 - 15.30 Fri. Thurs.- late opening 16.30-18,00 The staff consists of the manager and three assistants. The bank house where the manager lives, is situated in the same building as the bank.
